title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 3. Under Article 2 (2) in the 2008 Regulations the following definition is
text_raw:
3. Under Article 2 (2) in the 2008 Regulations the following definition is 

amended: 

“Bathing season” in each year, means a period identified by the local 
authorities, having regard to the period when large numbers of bathers can 
be expected and, at a minimum, a period identified as running from 1 June 
to 15 September in that year.

title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) for the purpose of giving effect to
heading: 4. Article 4(1) in the 2008 Regulations is substituted by the following:
text_raw:
4. Article 4(1) in the 2008 Regulations is substituted by the following: 

“Identification of bathing waters and definition of the length of the bathing 
season 

A local authority shall, in accordance with this Regulation, identify all 
bathing waters and define the length of the bathing season for each bathing 
water annually, before the start of the bathing season and not later than the 
24 March each year, and shall notify the EPA, in such form and in such 
manner as may be specified by the EPA, of the bathing waters so identified 
and bathing season so defined including the reason for any change 
compared to the previous year.”

heading: 6. Article 6(1) in the 2008 Regulations is substituted by the following:

6. Article 6(1) in the 2008 Regulations is substituted by the following: 

“A local authority shall, before the start of the bathing season and not later 
than 24 March, in each year, in relation to each bathing water identified by 
the authority in accordance with Regulation 4, establish a monitoring 
calendar in accordance with this Regulation and Schedule 2 and send a 
copy of the calendar to the EPA in such form and such manner as may be 
specified by the EPA.”

heading: 7. Article 10(1) in the 2008 Regulations is substituted by the following:

7. Article 10(1) in the 2008 Regulations is substituted by the following: 

“A local authority shall send to the EPA, not later than one month after the 
end of the bathing season in each year, the results of the monitoring, 
investigations and inspections carried out in relation to each bathing water 
by the authority during that year, in such form and such manner as may be 
specified by the EPA.”

text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations amend the Bathing Water Quality Regulations 2008. The 
purpose of the amendment is to provide for the local authorities to define the 
bathing season within their jurisdiction annually. The Regulations also change 
the definition of the “bathing season” to fully align with the definition specified 
in the Bathing Water Directive (2006/7/EC). The amendment also enables the 
EPA to specify pre- and post-season reporting deadlines for local authorities, 
depending on the period of the identified bathing season. This is to allow timely 
reporting to the EPA and to ensure that the reporting deadlines in the Directive 
are met.
